intro: Viguiera grammatoglossa, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for xeriscaping. Its striking purple to pink flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, attracting pollinators such as butterflies and bees. Viguiera grammatoglossa is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand drought conditions.
